header.name: Andrew Lu
header.address: 1762 Clifton Rd NE MSC 221290, Atlanta, GA 30322

education.degree: Bachelor of Science in Computer Science, Minor in Applied Math
details: Consistently achieved Dean's List recognition for academic excellence (Fall 2022, Spring 2023, Fall 2023)
Completed rigorous coursework in Data Structures, Algorithms, Computer Architecture, Linear Algebra, Machine Learning, Computational Linguistics, Data Mining, and a Practicum
Honored with membership in Phi Eta Sigma Honor Society and National Merit Scholar distinction

experience.company: Emory Libraries, Computing Center at Cox Hall
description: Ensure a seamless and tech-friendly environment for students and faculty by expertly managing the CCCH's audio-visual system
Maintain a secure and up-to-date online experience for over 200 students by overseeing the efficient operation of 32 computers and 4 printers

Significantly enhanced user experience for 5 million+ BibleBot users across 60,000+ Discord servers by implementing a custom configurable time-to-live HTTP cache, reducing service response latency by 60% (~400 ms)
Optimized resource utilization by creating custom middleware to strip stored responses, decreasing HTML and JSON cache usage by 99% and 39%, respectively
Rapidly adapted to C# and the ASP.NET framework by leveraging proficiency in Java, MVC, REST, and Git

projects.name: Personal Website
description: Designed and developed a personal portfolio website to showcase skills and gain hands-on experience with front-end technologies and design best practices, supporting Project Emory and RIDEmory's front-end/design teams

projects.name: RIDEmory
description: Spearheaded the development of a comprehensive rideshare solution for Emory students, featuring a self-updating database of ride information
Guided engineers in leveraging MongoDB's GeoJSON indexing to efficiently filter nearby rides and incorporate real-time traffic data
Taught Java, Spring Boot, MVC/REST principles, and collaboration best practices to the project's back-end team

projects.name: Voice Calculator
description: Developed a hands-free calculator as a proof-of-concept for a lightweight, deployable, voice-controlled application
Crafted modular grammar regular expressions to improve speech detection accuracy, even in noisy environments
Developed engaging Spring Boot, MongoDB, and Git curriculum to enhance the technical proficiency of over 20 members
Established and led Emory's only open project-building club, providing real-world coding experience to over 30 students
Mentored 2 Computer Science students through peer-programming, coursework guidance, and pre-professional support, contributing to their overall success in software engineering

Designed and developed an internal operations webpage, including an announcements board, HR service page, personal dashboard, and resources page, to provide Odyssey Family Consulting Center with a unified employee experience
Leveraged Figma for client-driven design and JavaScript for implementation of web pages
